weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Golem Greatbow is a uncommon Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Golem Greatbow comes with Through And Through Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.
A greatbow can only fire great arrows.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Greatbow is a common Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Greatbow comes with Through And Through Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Lion Greatbow
weapons.flavorText:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.
Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Lion Greatbow is a legendary Greatbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Lion Greatbow comes with Radahn's Rain Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Arbalest
weapons.flavorText:
Large crossbow made from composite materials. One of the largest of all bolt firing devices.
Its limbs are more pliable than metallic ones, allowing bolts fired from this weapon to pierce even forged of steel.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Arbalest is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Arbalest comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Crepus's Black-key Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.
Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Crepus's Black-key Crossbow is a uncommon Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Crepus's Black-key Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Heavy Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.
Commonly employed in the Shattering.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Heavy Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Heavy Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Light Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Light Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Light Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Soldier's Crossbow
weapons.flavorText: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Soldier's Crossbow is a common Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Soldier's Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Hand Ballista
weapons.flavorText:
An unconventional ballistic device modeled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.
Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Hand Ballista is a uncommon Ballista in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Hand Ballista comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Mantis Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A curved sword with a blade at both ends wielded by the Cemetery Shades, the insect-ridden grave keepers. 
The blade is thin and sharp, and strong attack unleashes a far-reaching slash.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Mantis Blade is a uncommon Curved Sword in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Slash, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Mantis Blade comes with  Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Executor's Blade
weapons.flavorText:
A single-edged katana with a long, sharp curved blade. A unique weapon wielded by the samurai from the Land of Reeds.
The Executor found the sword abondoned in the aftermath of a battle, and has wieldedit ever since. Stained with gold and rusted blood.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Executor's Blade is a legendary Katana in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Slash / Pierce, and it has innate Hemorrhage buildup on hit.
Executor's Blade comes with Unsheathe Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Raider's Greataxe
weapons.flavorText:
The Raider's preferred weapon, a greataxe fashioned from a ship's figurehead.
On his first voyage, the Raider vanquished countless pirates on the high seas. When a figurehead was dislodged from its ship during a tumultuos back-and-forth, the Raider claimed it for himself, that it might later server as a reminder of his glorious exploits.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Raider's Greataxe is a common Colossal Weapon in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength scaling.
Its attack affinity is Standard, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Raider's Greataxe comes with Endure Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Revenant's Cursed Claw
weapons.flavorText:
A silver accessory that attaches claws to the ring and little fingers.
A lady bore the claw before meeting a horrific death, which transformed the claw into a fetish. Swing to slash enemies apart.
Only the Revenant can make proper use of this weapon, owing to her resonance with the spiritual. For other warriors, the claw is reduced to a blunt instrument.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Revenant's Cursed Claw is a common Claw in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike / Slash, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Revenant's Cursed Claw comes with White Shadow's Lure Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Ironeye's Bow
weapons.flavorText:
A black, lustrous bow wielded by the Ironeye. One of the finest instruments crafted by the Fellowship.
The assassins of the Fellowship each wield unique weapons, such that targets marked for death anticipate all manner of approaches. Some of them, driven to the brink by fear, find relief by taking their own lives, before it is too late.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Ironeye's Bow is a common Bow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Ironeye's Bow comes with Mighty Shot Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Pulley Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.
One touch fires a volley of bolts.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Pulley Crossbow is a rare Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Pulley Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Full Moon Crossbow
weapons.flavorText:
One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship.
Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Full Moon Crossbow is a uncommon Crossbow in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Full Moon Crossbow comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Jar Cannon
weapons.flavorText:
Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.
Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Jar Cannon is a rare Ballista in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical damage and has no attribute scaling.
Its attack affinity is Pierce, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Jar Cannon comes with Kick Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Torch
weapons.flavorText:
This torch's tip is wrapped in oil-soaked rags and set on fire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or used to attack enemies.
Can be raised up when equipped in the left hand, illuminating more of the surrounding area.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Torch is a common Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Beast-Repellent Torch
weapons.flavorText:
A torch which burns oil infused with a special incense. The aroma pacifies wild beasts.
Torches such as these were used to keep unwelcome beasts away from treasure troves hidden in caves.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Beast-Repellent Torch is a common Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Beast-Repellent Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Steel-Wire Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Torch wound with metal wire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or be used to attack enemies.
Heavier than a normal torch, but the heated filament boosts fire damage dealt.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Steel-Wire Torch is a uncommon Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength and Dexterity scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Steel-Wire Torch comes with Firebreather Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Sentry's Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Torch given to protectors of the Erdtree. Its flames are bestowed with a special incantation which allows the bearer to see assassins cloaked in veils.
Furnished on behalf of the Erdtree and the Grace-Given Lord such that a Night of Black Knives will never come again.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Sentry's Torch is a uncommon Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical, Fire and Holy damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it does not have innate Status Ailment buildup on hit.
Sentry's Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: Ghostflame Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Metal torch that burns with cold ghostflame.
Tool of the Fallen Hawks who prowl the underground rivers.
When the band's last embers were used up in their long search,
they began to burn the bones of their fellows,
acquiring the cold ghostflame,
but sealing their fate as dwellers of the underground for all eternity.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
Ghostflame Torch is a rare Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Magic damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Intelligence scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it has innate Frostbite buildup on hit.
Ghostflame Torch comes with Torch Attack Ash of War (Weapon Skill).

weapons.name: St. Trina's Torch
weapons.flavorText:
Candlestand torch that burns with a light-purple flame. The carvings depict St. Trina, but in adult form, somewhat unnervingly.
The light-purple flame induces sleep.
weapons.wikiWeaponDescriptionText:
St. Trina's Torch is a rare Torch in Elden Ring Nightreign. This weapon deals Physical and Fire damage and has Strength, Dexterity and Faith scaling.
Its attack affinity is Strike, and it has innate Sleep buildup on hit.
St. Trina's Torch comes with Fires of Slumber Ash of War (Weapon Skill).
